intro: Dipcadi viride, commonly known as green squill, is a flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically growing in woodland and scrub habitats. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves and produces clusters of pale greenish-white flowers. Its bulbs are toxic and have been historically used in traditional medicine. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its preference for partial shade.
